definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: The accident was the preface to a great scientific discovery.
sentences.chinese: 这一偶然事务成了一项重大科学发明的前奏。

sentences.english: Finding Your Soul Mate - Prelude To A Successful Marriage?
sentences.chinese: 找到你的灵魂伴侣是幸福婚姻的前奏吗？

sentences.english: Error is often the precursor of what is correct, but conceit is the prelude to a fall.
sentences.chinese: 错误往往是正确的先导，骄傲是跌跤的前奏。

sentences.english: This one could be a prelude to the anger and disillusionment that is only beginning to swell.
sentences.chinese: 这可能就是刚刚开始膨胀的愤怒和醒悟的前奏。

sentences.english: Bach. One Prelude and Fugue from Well-tempered Clavier.
sentences.chinese: 巴赫，《十二平均律钢琴曲集》一个前奏和赋格曲。

sentences.english: Yet it was all simply prelude.
sentences.chinese: 但所有的这些不过是前奏。

sentences.english: Piano piece "Prelude 6" belongs to his original song.
sentences.chinese: 钢琴作品《前奏曲六首》属于他的独创曲。

sentences.english: It is one of Bach's most tightly organized and yet viscerally effective prelude and fugue pairs.
sentences.chinese: 此曲是巴赫组织最为严密高效的前奏曲与赋格之一。

sentences.english: Hitler's invasion of Russia is no more than a prelude to an attempted invasion of the British Isles.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒侵略俄国不过是企图侵略不列颠诸岛的前奏。

sentences.english: The orchestra played a short prelude before the ballet began.
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队在芭蕾舞开始之前演奏了一段很短的前奏曲。

sentences.english: Han's family in Jinguo Cheng-long course is a prelude to the establishment of South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 韩氏家族在晋国成长的历程，是韩国建立的前奏。

sentences.english: All of deeply dark nights are the preludes of daytimes.
sentences.chinese: 沉沉的黑夜都是白天的前奏。

sentences.english: The Well-Tempered Clavier (24), collection of preludes & fugues, Book II.
sentences.chinese: 平均律钢琴集24首，收集的前奏曲和赋格，第2册。

sentences.english: Music which precedes something else. Also a self contained short piece for piano.
sentences.chinese: 音乐引子或前奏，也同时是独立的钢琴短曲。

sentences.english: The prelude and coda echo from beginning to end.
The inscription became a prelude of the surrender of Gu's military unit to the Qing army ten months later.
sentences.chinese: 题字成为十个月后该部全体投降清军的前奏曲。

definition: music played during a movie, play etc/incidental music/music played in a theatrical interlude/(fig.) incident/episode
(of alcohol) to ferment/(of a crisis) to be brewing/to mull over (an issue)/to hold exploratory discussions
